result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Heinowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael L Heinowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Michael L Heinowski.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA TenHaken. Called @ 3:02 p.m. Matter before the court for waiver of preliminary hearing on 22CF480 and initial appearance on new file - 22CM526. Record by Atty. Lochowicz who is appointed on the felony file and asks to be appointed on the misdemeanor as well. Court orders him appointed on the CM file. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant as to the felony file. Court finds waiver to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and binds the defendant over for trial. Record by the State that the information will mirror the charges in the complaint. Response by Atty. Lochowicz who would like to proceed to arraignment today. Atty. enters not guilty pleas and demands a speedy trial at this time, but requests status before trial dates are set.  Atty. goes over charges/penalties as to new file and enters NG pleas in that file as well. 
Court addresses request to lift the no contact on file.  Record by Atty. Lochowicz that they would like contact allowed while the defendant is in the Walworth County Jail including phone and supervised visits. State objects to modification.
Victim is present in Court and responds to Court's questions. Victim is asking to have contact with the defendant and makes a record as to situation/reasons. Further record as to counseling and response to Court's questions. 
Court amends bond to allow contact while the defendant is in custody and sets matter for status as requested.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
